item.title: How to save your online writing from disappearing forever
item.description:
While the notion lingers that “the internet is forever,” it can also feel like it’s written on water. If you’re an internet-based creative, the company that publishes your writing or exhibits an online gallery of your work can suddenly fold (see: Gawker or Game Informer), migrate content management systems, or simply unpublish older work. In that case, the article you researched for a month, the story you carefully constructed, or the gallery of photos that you painstakingly put together could, in that moment, be forever unavailable. And if you’ve linked to your work in a blog or social network, that link has now become useless.

So what do you do? You can save a PDF of each of your works to a local drive, an online storage service, or to...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Barbara Krasnoff

item.title: Move over SEO, Profound is helping brands with AI search optimization
item.description:
Search engine optimization (SEO) has been top of mind for brands for more than a decade to ensure their websites and products capture as many eyeballs as possible by ranking high up on search results pages. But search is changing, and as consumers increasingly turn to AI chatbots like ChatGPT or Claude to search for […]

item.description: On July 18, 2024, Dyson officially revealed its newest product — OnTrac Headphones, premium noise-cancelling headphones. Here are my first impressions.
